entities.name: grindelwald
entities.description: Grindelwald is described as an 'invincible master of death' and has a complex relationship with the narrator. He loses control during an argument, revealing his darker nature.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is described as having a gentle and caring side, as he begins to cry when remembering the death of Ariana. He also shows a sense of control and composure in the face of Grindelwald's outburst.

entities.name: ariana
entities.description: Ariana is described as being cared for by their mother, but ultimately dies due to Grindelwald's actions. Her death has a profound impact on Dumbledore.

entities.name: hallows
entities.description: The Hallows are mentioned as something that the narrator wants to seek, but is deemed too unstable and fragile to do so with their sister in tow.

relationships.description: Grindelwald's actions lead to the death of Ariana, as described in the text: 'And Ariana . . . after all my mother’s care and caution . . . lay dead upon the ﬂoor.'
Grindelwald and Dumbledore have a complex and antagonistic relationship, as described in the text: 'Invincible masters of death, Grindelwald and Dumbledore!'
Dumbledore is deeply affected by Ariana's death, as described in the text: 'Dumbledore gave a little gasp and began to cry in earnest.'
